body:
PR #13334 allows kubelet to update annotations.

This broke mirror pods because they contain the original source annotations.
- Mirror pod contains all annotations from the original static pod, including `config.source: file`
- When the config watcher first sees the mirror pod from the apiserver, it sets the `config.source: api` to the annotations in the mirror pod and caches it.
- The next time, the config watcher would compare the mirror pod with the copy in the cache, and sees the difference:

```
existing: map[string]string{"kubernetes.io/config.mirror":"mirror", "kubernetes.io/config.seen":"2015-09-11T19:10:12.335167065Z", "kubernetes.io/config.source":"api"}
new: map[string]string{"kubernetes.io/config.mirror":"mirror", "kubernetes.io/config.seen":"2015-09-11T19:09:21.926288705Z", "kubernetes.io/config.source":"file"}
```

The config watcher would then think this is an update and trigger a kubelet pod sync. The mirror pod would also be mistaken as regular pod later on in kubelet, causing more attempts to create a mirror pod. These extra syncs and operations may have caused the cpu spikes observed in #12429

Kubelet should always overwrites the source annotation before comparing existing and the new pods at the config watcher.
